The '''Hyacinth Chen School of Nursing''' was officially opened on the 10th of August 2008 on a location directly across from the [[Northern Caribbean University]] campus across from NCU's Dental Centre located in [[Mandeville, Jamaica|Mandeville]], [[Jamaica]].
The school is owned by the [[Seventh-day Adventist Church]] in Jamaica. The school is being named in honour of Mrs. Hyacinth Chen, the mother of major donor, [[Michael Lee-Chin]], Jamaican/[[Canada|Canadian]] businessman.
The school will hold 800 nursing students and will reduce Jamaica's [[nursing shortage]].
